message.content:
cs.MA, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with distributed computation in multi-agent systems, which is a topic that falls under the category of Multi-Agent Systems (cs.MA). The use of pairwise gossips between randomly selected agents suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The problem of forgetting outdated information is related to the topic of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). The focus on open systems and the possibility of agents leaving and arriving during the execution of the algorithm suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Finally, the use of algorithms to compute the maximum of values held by agents suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of Information Theory (cs.IT).
